Article Title: Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy government targeted my family with cases, says ex-CJI N V Ramana
Article Text:
Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy government targeted my family with cases, says ex-CJI N V Ramana

Justice Ramana

slams attempts to crush farmers’ movement

Justice N V Ramana (retd) disclosed Saturday that the Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy government filed police cases against his family to target him before he became the Chief Justice of India in 2021 because they supported Amaravati capital city project of Andhra Pradesh."All of you present here know how my family was targeted and criminal cases were filed against them. All this was done only to coerce me," he said while addressing students at the convocation ceremony of VIT-AP at Amaravati.The Jagan Reddy government diluted the previous N Chandrababu Naidu government's Amaravati capital project by announcing the trifurcation of the capital, which was opposed by farmers whose land had already been acquired.The farmers agitated for five years from 2019 till 2024 and the trifurcation idea was dropped after the Chandrababu Naidu government returned to office last year.Recalling his deep association with Amaravati since his student days, he said, "Present-day Amaravati owes its existence to the resilience of the farmers of this region. The city survives on the back of the farmers' struggle, one of the longest in southern India."Talking about attempts to "crush the farmers' struggle", Justice Ramana said, "Rarely the media or any politician ever spoken the truth or given real credit as to how the capital of Amaravati survived and sustained," he said.Briefly touching on the "painful days of police action" against his family members, the former CJI said, "I was not alone. During that difficult period, all those who empathised with the cause of the farmers, faced intimidation and coercion." "Even members of the judiciary who upheld constitutional principles faced transfers, pressure, and at times, persecution. Families of judges, who had no role, suffered collateral damage because of political machinations," he said.In these testing times, many political leaders hesitated to take a stand and preferred silence, he said. "It was the jurists, lawyers and the courts which stood by their constitutional promise," he said. "While govts may change, the courts and the rule of law remain as the anchor of stability. The rule of law survives only when people, in whom the public repose trust, decline to surrender their integrity for convenience," he said."In the coming times, the role of farmers, lawyers, jurists, members of civil society and judges will have to remain the enduring source of inspiration with their integrity and commitment to rule of law," he said.
Article Summary: Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy government filed police cases against his family to target him before he became the Chief Justice of India in 2021. His family supported Amaravati capital city project of Andhra Pradesh. The farmers agitated for five years from 2019 till 2024 and the trifurcation idea was dropped after the Chandrababu Naidu government returned to office.

Article Title: 'What he is saying is a lie': Kharge hits out at PM Modi's 'Katta' charge; calls it 'laughable'
Article Text:
PM Modi Rips Into RJD-Congress For ‘Insulting Faith’, Warns Bihar Voters

NEW DELHI: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday refuted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's allegation that Rashtriya Janata Dal forced Congress to announce Tejashwi Yadav as Mahagathbandhan's pick for Bihar's chief minister's post.Kharge said that PM Modi's remarks were "laughable", claiming that he sets aside he level at which a PM should speak."All of this is a lie. He has nothing else to say. I will answer this today in Bihar. What he is saying is a lie. Nobody will tell someone else to make someone the CM at gunpoint," Kharge said."Congress has never done this. Modi ji is the PM of this country; his saying such things is laughable. This shows his level. He sets aside the level at which a PM should speak and is making election speeches in Bihar," he added.This comes a day after PM Modi on Sunday alleged thate Congress “never wanted” Tejashwi to be declared the alliance’s CM face but was pressured into doing so.“The RJD secured it by placing a katta (country-made gun) on the head of the Congress. They have learnt their lessons in the school of jungle raj. Such elements can never do good for Bihar,” he said at a rally in Bhojpur."Just a day before nomination filing, behind closed doors, gundagardi was happening. Congress did not want to have an RJD CM, but RJD did not leave the opportunity. They put a Katta on Congress' head and stole the CM’s post," he added.He further claimed that the alliance partners were divided and would “break each other’s heads” after the elections.Hectic campaigning in poll-bound Bihar is set to continue on Monday, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge scheduled to address a host of public rallies across the state.The party's octogenarian national president Mallikarjun Kharge will also address his maiden election meeting, ahead of assembly polls, in Vaishali district.Polling for Bihar’s 243 assembly seats will take place in two phases: on November 6 and 11, with counting on November 14.
Article Summary: Kharge said that PM Modi's remarks were "laughable", claiming that he sets aside he level at which a PM should speak. Polling for Bihar’s 243 assembly seats will take place in two phases: on November 6 and 11, with counting on November 14.

Article Title: Rajasthan: 15 pilgrims killed, 2 injured as tourist bus collides with trailer in Phalodi
Article Text:
15 pilgrims killed in Rajasthan

NEW DELHI: Fifteen pilgrims were killed and two were seriously injured on Sunday after a tourist bus collided with a stationary trailer in Rajasthan's Phalodi. The bus was returning from Bikaner."15 people have lost their lives in a road accident in Phalodi district. Two are injured. The injured persons are undergoing treatment. The affected family have our full support," Police Commissioner Om Prakash Paswan told news agency PTI.He further added, "A green corridor is being established to quickly transport the injured to a facility where they can receive proper medical treatment. The administration is focused on saving the lives of those injured and will release further details as more information becomes available"."We have received directions from the Collector and the Commissioner for the preparations. Two patients have come in and both are stable, though with multiple injuries. Both have been taken into the red zone... We have entire team of doctors here," Mathuradas Mathur Hospital Superintendent Vikas Rajpurohit told ANI.Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced ex-gratia of Rs 2 lakh from PMNRF to the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 for the injured."Saddened by the loss of lives due to a mishap in Phalodi district, Rajasthan. My thoughts are with the affected people and their families during this difficult time. Praying for the speedy recovery of the injured. An ex-gratia of Rs. 2 lakh from PMNRF would be given to the next of kin of each deceased. The injured would be given Rs. 50,000," PM Modi said.Rajasthan chief minister Bhajanlal Sharma said he instructed the officials to ensure proper treatment for all the injured."The loss of lives in the road accident in the Matoda area of Phalodi is extremely tragic and heart-rending. My condolences are with the bereaved families. Instructions have been issued to the district administration officials to ensure proper treatment for all the injured. I pray to the Lord to grant peace to the departed souls and to bestow swift recovery upon the injured," CM Sharma said.
Article Summary: 15 people have lost their lives in a road accident in Phalodi district. The injured persons are undergoing treatment. Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced ex-gratia of Rs 2 lakh from PMNRF to the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 for the injured.

Article Text:
Jason Kelce, retired Eagles star, has revealed his choices for PEOPLE's 2025 Sexiest Man Alive. He picked Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson for the top spot. Kelce also surprisingly nominated NFL rookie Cam Skattebo. Kelce's humble approach to his own past title continues to charm fans. His selections highlight energy and narrative beyond just looks.

Jason Kelce says The Rock has the top spot wrapped already

Jason Kelce also praises Giants rookie Cam Skattebo’s appeal

Jason Kelce’s humility keeps the Kelce humor alive



More coverage on NFL:

Jason Kelce may be retired from the NFL, but his personality still pulls as much attention as it did when he was the unstoppable anchor of the Philadelphia Eagles. Now, with PEOPLE preparing to reveal its 2025 Sexiest Man Alive, Jason is weighing in with two surprising picks of his own.Instead of playing it safe, he went straight for star power, nominating Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson first and then gave love to a rising NFL name, rookie Cam Skattebo, who recently suffered a devastating injury. For someone who himself held the title in 2023, Jason is hilariously humble about his place in the “attractive rankings,” and is using his new fragrance launch to joke that maybe his sexy label was accidental.Jason told PEOPLE, “I just had The Rock on the podcast and it's hard to say that anybody's sexier than that.” That’s a headline in itself, because Dwayne Johnson remains one of the most influential entertainment figures on earth. Article Title: Who is Brian Schottenheimer’s wife? All you need to know about Cowboys head coach's life partner and their journey together
Article Text:
Brian Schottenheimer with his wife Gemmi (Via Instagram)

Who is Gemmi Schottenheimer?



How Gemmi Schottenheimer supported Brian through NFL challenges



More coverage on NFL:

In the high-stakes world of the NFL, where coaches are constantly under pressure to deliver results, few pause to notice the steady forces that keep them grounded. For Dallas Cowboys head coach Brian Schottenheimer, that unwavering force is his wife, Gemmi Schottenheimer. Her life may unfold away from the sidelines and flashing cameras, but her presence has shaped Brian’s career and family in ways only those closest to them can truly understand. Behind every play call and every move across teams, Gemmi has been the quiet constant—strong, patient, and deeply supportive.Gemmi Schottenheimer has lived through the highs and lows of the NFL lifestyle. From team changes to unexpected firings, she has been Brian’s anchor in an unpredictable profession. Before their marriage, fate brought her close to his family in a rather unusual way. While working for the Washington Redskins, Gemmi crossed paths with legendary coach Marty Schottenheimer, who happened to be Brian’s father. She recalled in a 2024 podcast with Stacey Bell, “I had not met Brian at that point. I sort of became an assistant to him [Marty] while he was trying to find one. I was on his voicemail. I did all these things and just sort of had an opportunity to watch him lead without being in the family or dating Brian.”Ironically, when she finally met Brian, she didn’t even realize who his father was. “When I met Brian, didn’t even know that he was Marty’s son in the beginning… So it was just kind of unique for me to transition into a daughter-in-law,” Gemmi said. Over the years, their relationship only grew stronger, especially during the toughest times — like when Marty was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s in 2016. Through those painful moments, Gemmi held the family together, showing the same calm strength that defines her today.Life with an NFL coach demands patience and adaptability. For Gemmi, that meant managing home life, raising two children, and maintaining a sense of stability while Brian juggled long hours and constant team transitions. Her resilience shone through even during career shocks. Reflecting on tough times, she said, “The Seattle firing, you know, was definitely something we didn’t see coming. We had just won the division. And as you know, I mean, Marty was fired after a 14 and two season. So these firings, it can happen when you least expect it.”Beyond the sidelines, Gemmi’s support also extended to moments of celebration. When Brian was named Cowboys head coach in 2025, Gemmi learned the news directly from Jerry and Stephen Jones. “I got out of [Brian’s] truck and started saying, ‘Oh my gosh! Oh my gosh!’ I didn’t have anyone to talk to. I was by myself, but it was really special,” she recalled.Gemmi may not wear a headset on game day, but she’s every bit a part of Brian’s success. Her quiet strength and enduring love have shaped his journey. Together, the Schottenheimers have shown that true partnership — built on trust, loyalty, and resilience — is the real foundation of greatness.
Article Summary: Gemmi Schottenheimer has lived through the highs and lows of the NFL lifestyle. From team changes to unexpected firings, she has been Brian’s anchor in an unpredictable profession. Gemmi has been the quiet constant behind every play call and every move across teams.

Article Title: Harvard initiative brings together nine US states to identify effective education policies: Here's what to know
Article Text:
The Harvard Crimson

The Crimson

From research to reform

The Crimson

A long time in the making

The Crimson

A bipartisan approach to learning



The Crimson.

When the Harvard Graduate School of Education (HGSE) launched its States Leading States (SLS) initiative earlier this year, its goal was not to dictate policy but to measure what works, and why. Last month, the programme announced its first cohort of nine partner states: Alabama, Colorado, Delaware, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Rhode Island, Tennessee, and Texas.The initiative, led by the Centre for Education Policy Research (CEPR) at HGSE, will collaborate with local governments to assess a spectrum of education policies — from literacy programmes in Colorado to summer reading and mathematics camps in Alabama. The idea is to establish a consistent, evidence-based understanding of which state-level policies genuinely improve student learning outcomes,reports.Scott E. Sargrad, senior director of the initiative, toldthat the project aims to strengthen both state leadership and collective learning. “What we are hoping to do with this project is support state leadership, but also support learning about what’s actually working with state policy,” he said.The programme’s first report is expected this spring and will share early findings across its participating states. In Illinois, for instance, education officials are keen to understand whether restricting student mobile phone use can enhance classroom focus and academic performance. Illinois State Superintendent of Education Anthony “Tony” V. Sanders toldthat the partnership offers “a powerful forum to exchange ideas, strengthen data use, and support continuous school improvement.”The Illinois case illustrates the SLS model: identifying local challenges, collecting comparative data, and developing metrics to measure success. For Sanders, that means quantifying the impact of cell phone bans on student engagement, a question that resonates with school systems nationwide.Although formally launched in January, the idea for the SLS programme dates back nearly two decades. CEPR faculty director Professor Thomas J. Kane recalled that in 2005, Joel I. Klein, then Chancellor of the New York City Department of Education, had approached Harvard researchers to evaluate elements of the city’s schooling system. The request, Kane told, revealed a broader capacity gap. “Because he was saying he didn’t have the internal capacity to do this kind of work, we just thought, ‘Well gosh, if Joel Klein, the chancellor of the largest school district in the country, doesn’t have the capacity to do this, then nobody does,’” he said.That observation eventually led CEPR to raise funds for a sustained, data-focused collaboration among US states. The SLS initiative will run for four years. It will also draw on a network of more than 700 trained data analysts from Harvard’s Strategic Data Project — a CEPR effort that, since 2008, has focused on embedding data science in education policy.Kane emphasised that SLS was deliberately structured as a bipartisan programme. Its first cohort includes both conservative and liberal states — a design choice meant to prioritise areas where agreement is still possible. “Our plan is to stay away from culture war issues,” he explained, focusing instead on reducing absenteeism and improving student achievement.That approach feels particularly urgent at a time when US academic performance has been declining for over a decade. Kane said the programme hopes to offer practical, evidence-backed answers to reverse the trend. “We’re really focused on trying to provide some answers on that in the next year,” he toldFor Harvard, the initiative represents more than a new research collaboration, it signals an effort to rebuild trust in education policymaking through data, not debate. The results, expected in the coming months, may help state leaders navigate one of the most enduring questions in American education: how to make policy that truly works in schools.
Article Summary: The States Leading States (SLS) initiative will assess a spectrum of education policies. The idea is to establish a consistent, evidence-based understanding of which state-level policies genuinely improve student learning outcomes. The programme’s first report is expected this spring and will share early findings across its participating states.
